org.openimaj.lsh.functions

Class ByteHyperplaneCosineFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.lsh.functions.RandomisedHashFunctionFactory<byte[]>
      • org.openimaj.lsh.functions.ByteHashFunctionFactory
        • org.openimaj.lsh.functions.ByteHyperplaneCosineFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HashFunctionFactory<byte[]>

    @Reference(type=Inproceedings,
           author="Charikar, Moses S.",
           title="Similarity estimation techniques from rounding algorithms",
           year="2002",
           booktitle="Proceedings of the thiry-fourth annual ACM symposium on Theory of computing",
           pages={"380","","388"},
           url="http://doi.acm.org/10.1145/509907.509965",
           publisher="ACM",
           series="STOC \'02")
public class ByteHyperplaneCosineFactory
extends ByteHashFunctionFactory
    A hash function factory that produces hash functions that approximate cosine distance using hyperplanes.

    The hash function hashes the input vector into a binary value (i.e. 0 or 1). A random vector on the surface of a hypersphere is generated during construction. The hash code is computed by calculating the dot product of the random vector with the input vector and testing to see whether the value is greater than or equal to 0 (1 is output) or less than 0 (0 is output).

    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
